00053 /** This is a small utility structure that records information related to one
00054     level of nested control flow.  It's mostly used in correctly restoring
00055     the mask and other state as we exit control flow nesting levels. 
00056 */
00057 struct CFInfo {
00058     /** Returns a new instance of the structure that represents entering an
00059         'if' statement */
00060     static CFInfo *GetIf(bool isUniform, llvm::Value *savedMask);
00061 
00062     /** Returns a new instance of the structure that represents entering a
00063         loop. */
00064     static CFInfo *GetLoop(bool isUniform, llvm::BasicBlock *breakTarget,
00065                            llvm::BasicBlock *continueTarget, 
00066                            llvm::Value *savedBreakLanesPtr,
00067                            llvm::Value *savedContinueLanesPtr,
00068                            llvm::Value *savedMask, llvm::Value *savedLoopMask);
00069 
00070     bool IsIf() { return type == If; }
00071     bool IsLoop() { return type == Loop; }
00072     bool IsVaryingType() { return !isUniform; }
00073     bool IsUniform() { return isUniform; }
00074 
00075     enum CFType { If, Loop };
00076     CFType type;
00077     bool isUniform;
00078     llvm::BasicBlock *savedBreakTarget, *savedContinueTarget;
00079     llvm::Value *savedBreakLanesPtr, *savedContinueLanesPtr;
00080     llvm::Value *savedMask, *savedLoopMask;
00081 
00082 private:
00083     CFInfo(CFType t, bool uniformIf, llvm::Value *sm) {
00084         assert(t == If);
00085         type = t;
00086         isUniform = uniformIf;
00087         savedBreakTarget = savedContinueTarget = NULL;
00088         savedBreakLanesPtr = savedContinueLanesPtr = NULL;
00089         savedMask = savedLoopMask = sm;
00090     }
00091     CFInfo(CFType t, bool iu, llvm::BasicBlock *bt, llvm::BasicBlock *ct,
00092            llvm::Value *sb, llvm::Value *sc, llvm::Value *sm,
00093            llvm::Value *lm) {
00094         assert(t == Loop);
00095         type = t;
00096         isUniform = iu;
00097         savedBreakTarget = bt;
00098         savedContinueTarget = ct;
00099         savedBreakLanesPtr = sb;
00100         savedContinueLanesPtr = sc;
00101         savedMask = sm;
00102         savedLoopMask = lm;
00103     }
00104 };
00105 
00106 
00107 CFInfo *
00108 CFInfo::GetIf(bool isUniform, llvm::Value *savedMask) {
00109     return new CFInfo(If, isUniform, savedMask);
00110 }
00111 
00112 
00113 CFInfo *
00114 CFInfo::GetLoop(bool isUniform, llvm::BasicBlock *breakTarget,
00115                 llvm::BasicBlock *continueTarget, 
00116                 llvm::Value *savedBreakLanesPtr,
00117                 llvm::Value *savedContinueLanesPtr,
00118                 llvm::Value *savedMask, llvm::Value *savedLoopMask) {
00119     return new CFInfo(Loop, isUniform, breakTarget, continueTarget,
00120                       savedBreakLanesPtr, savedContinueLanesPtr,
00121                       savedMask, savedLoopMask);
00122 }

00126 FunctionEmitContext::FunctionEmitContext(const Type *rt, llvm::Function *function,
00127                                          Symbol *funSym, SourcePos firstStmtPos) {
00128     /* Create a new basic block to store all of the allocas */
00129     allocaBlock = llvm::BasicBlock::Create(*g->ctx, "allocas", function, 0);
00130     bblock = llvm::BasicBlock::Create(*g->ctx, "entry", function, 0);
00131     /* But jump from it immediately into the real entry block */
00132     llvm::BranchInst::Create(bblock, allocaBlock);
00133 
00134     maskPtr = AllocaInst(LLVMTypes::MaskType, "mask_memory");
00135     StoreInst(LLVMMaskAllOn, maskPtr);
00136 
00137     funcStartPos = funSym->pos;
00138     returnType = rt;
00139     entryMask = NULL;
00140     loopMask = NULL;
00141     breakLanesPtr = continueLanesPtr = NULL;
00142     breakTarget = continueTarget = NULL;
00143 
00144     returnedLanesPtr = AllocaInst(LLVMTypes::MaskType, "returned_lanes_memory");
00145     StoreInst(LLVMMaskAllOff, returnedLanesPtr);
00146 
00147     launchedTasks = false;
00148     launchGroupHandlePtr = AllocaInst(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType, "launch_group_handle");
00149     StoreInst(llvm::Constant::getNullValue(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType), 
00150               launchGroupHandlePtr);
00151 
00152     if (!returnType || returnType == AtomicType::Void)
00153         returnValuePtr = NULL;
00154     else {
00155         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *ftype = returnType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
00156         returnValuePtr = AllocaInst(ftype, "return_value_memory");
00157         // FIXME: don't do this store???
00158         StoreInst(llvm::Constant::getNullValue(ftype), returnValuePtr);
00159     }
00160 
00161     if (m->diBuilder) {
00162         /* If debugging is enabled, tell the debug information emission
00163            code about this new function */
00164         diFile = funcStartPos.GetDIFile();
00165         llvm::DIType retType = rt->GetDIType(diFile);
00166         int flags = llvm::DIDescriptor::FlagPrototyped; // ??
00167         diFunction = m->diBuilder->createFunction(diFile, /* scope */
00168                                                   function->getName(), // mangled
00169                                                   funSym->name,
00170                                                   diFile,
00171                                                   funcStartPos.first_line,
00172                                                   retType,
00173                                                   funSym->isStatic,
00174                                                   true, /* is definition */
00175                                                   flags,
00176                                                   g->opt.level > 0,
00177                                                   function);
00178         /* And start a scope representing the initial function scope */
00179         StartScope();
00180     }
00181 
00182     // connect the funciton's mask memory to the __mask symbol
00183     Symbol *maskSymbol = m->symbolTable->LookupVariable("__mask");
00184     assert(maskSymbol != NULL);
00185     maskSymbol->storagePtr = maskPtr;
00186 
00187     // add debugging info for __mask, programIndex, ...
00188     if (m->diBuilder) {
00189         maskSymbol->pos = funcStartPos;
00190         EmitVariableDebugInfo(maskSymbol);
00191 
00192         llvm::DIFile file = funcStartPos.GetDIFile();
00193         Symbol *programIndexSymbol = m->symbolTable->LookupVariable("programIndex");
00194         assert(programIndexSymbol && programIndexSymbol->storagePtr);
00195         m->diBuilder->createGlobalVariable(programIndexSymbol->name, 
00196                                            file,
00197                                            funcStartPos.first_line,
00198                                            programIndexSymbol->type->GetDIType(file),
00199                                            true /* static */,
00200                                            programIndexSymbol->storagePtr);
00201 
00202         Symbol *programCountSymbol = m->symbolTable->LookupVariable("programCount");
00203         assert(programCountSymbol);
00204         m->diBuilder->createGlobalVariable(programCountSymbol->name, 
00205                                            file,
00206                                            funcStartPos.first_line,
00207                                            programCountSymbol->type->GetDIType(file),
00208                                            true /* static */,
00209                                            programCountSymbol->storagePtr);
00210     }
00211 }

00214 FunctionEmitContext::~FunctionEmitContext() {
00215     assert(controlFlowInfo.size() == 0);
00216     assert(debugScopes.size() == (m->diBuilder ? 1 : 0));
00217 }

00252 FunctionEmitContext::SetMask(llvm::Value *value) {

00257 void
00258 FunctionEmitContext::MaskAnd(llvm::Value *oldMask, llvm::Value *test) {
00259     llvm::Value *mask = BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And, oldMask, 
00260                                        test, "oldMask&test");
00261     SetMask(mask);
00262 }
00263 
00264 
00265 void
00266 FunctionEmitContext::MaskAndNot(llvm::Value *oldMask, llvm::Value *test) {
00267     llvm::Value *notTest = BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Xor, test, LLVMMaskAllOn,
00268                                           "~test");
00269     llvm::Value *mask = BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And, oldMask, notTest,
00270                                        "oldMask&~test");
00271     SetMask(mask);
00272 }

00275 void
00276 FunctionEmitContext::BranchIfMaskAny(llvm::BasicBlock *btrue, llvm::BasicBlock *bfalse) {
00277     assert(bblock != NULL);
00278     llvm::Value *any = Any(GetMask());
00279     BranchInst(btrue, bfalse, any);
00280     // It's illegal to add any additional instructions to the basic block
00281     // now that it's terminated, so set bblock to NULL to be safe
00282     bblock = NULL;
00283 }
00284 
00285 
00286 void
00287 FunctionEmitContext::BranchIfMaskAll(llvm::BasicBlock *btrue, llvm::BasicBlock *bfalse) {
00288     assert(bblock != NULL);
00289     llvm::Value *all = All(GetMask());
00290     BranchInst(btrue, bfalse, all);
00291     // It's illegal to add any additional instructions to the basic block
00292     // now that it's terminated, so set bblock to NULL to be safe
00293     bblock = NULL;
00294 }

00296 
00297 void
00298 FunctionEmitContext::BranchIfMaskNone(llvm::BasicBlock *btrue, llvm::BasicBlock *bfalse) {
00299     assert(bblock != NULL);
00300     // switch sense of true/false bblocks
00301     BranchIfMaskAny(bfalse, btrue);
00302     // It's illegal to add any additional instructions to the basic block
00303     // now that it's terminated, so set bblock to NULL to be safe
00304     bblock = NULL;
00305 }

00309 FunctionEmitContext::StartUniformIf(llvm::Value *oldMask) {
00310     controlFlowInfo.push_back(CFInfo::GetIf(true, oldMask));
00311 }

00313 
00314 void
00315 FunctionEmitContext::StartVaryingIf(llvm::Value *oldMask) {
00316     controlFlowInfo.push_back(CFInfo::GetIf(false, oldMask));

00319 
00320 void
00321 FunctionEmitContext::EndIf() {
00322     // Make sure we match up with a Start{Uniform,Varying}If().
00323     assert(controlFlowInfo.size() > 0 && controlFlowInfo.back()->IsIf());
00324     CFInfo *ci = controlFlowInfo.back();
00325     controlFlowInfo.pop_back();
00326 
00327     // 'uniform' ifs don't change the mask so we only need to restore the
00328     // mask going into the if for 'varying' if statements
00329     if (!ci->IsUniform() && bblock != NULL) {
00330         // We can't just restore the mask as it was going into the 'if'
00331         // statement.  First we have to take into account any program
00332         // instances that have executed 'return' statements; the restored
00333         // mask must be off for those lanes.
00334         restoreMaskGivenReturns(ci->savedMask);
00335 
00336         // If the 'if' statement is inside a loop with a 'varying'
00337         // consdition, we also need to account for any break or continue
00338         // statements that executed inside the 'if' statmeent; we also must
00339         // leave the lane masks for the program instances that ran those
00340         // off after we restore the mask after the 'if'.  The code below
00341         // ends up being optimized out in the case that there were no break
00342         // or continue statements (and breakLanesPtr and continueLanesPtr
00343         // have their initial 'all off' values), so we don't need to check
00344         // for that here.
00345         if (breakLanesPtr != NULL) {
00346             assert(continueLanesPtr != NULL);
00347 
00348             // newMask = (oldMask & ~(breakLanes | continueLanes))
00349             llvm::Value *oldMask = GetMask();
00350             llvm::Value *breakLanes = LoadInst(breakLanesPtr, NULL, 
00351                                                "break_lanes");
00352             llvm::Value *continueLanes = LoadInst(continueLanesPtr, NULL, 
00353                                                   "continue_lanes");
00354             llvm::Value *breakOrContinueLanes = 
00355                 BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Or, breakLanes, continueLanes,
00356                                "break|continue_lanes");
00357             llvm::Value *notBreakOrContinue = NotOperator(breakOrContinueLanes,
00358                                                           "!(break|continue)_lanes");
00359             llvm::Value *newMask = 
00360                 BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And, oldMask, notBreakOrContinue, 
00361                                "new_mask");
00362             SetMask(newMask);
00363         }
00364     }
00365 }
00366 
00367 
00368 void
00369 FunctionEmitContext::StartLoop(llvm::BasicBlock *bt, llvm::BasicBlock *ct, 
00370                                bool uniformCF, llvm::Value *oldMask) {
00371     // Store the current values of various loop-related state so that we
00372     // can restore it when we exit this loop.
00373     controlFlowInfo.push_back(CFInfo::GetLoop(uniformCF, breakTarget, 
00374                                               continueTarget, breakLanesPtr,
00375                                               continueLanesPtr, oldMask, loopMask));
00376     if (uniformCF)
00377         // If the loop has a uniform condition, we don't need to track
00378         // which lanes 'break' or 'continue'; all of the running ones go
00379         // together, so we just jump
00380         breakLanesPtr = continueLanesPtr = NULL;
00381     else {
00382         // For loops with varying conditions, allocate space to store masks
00383         // that record which lanes have done these
00384         continueLanesPtr = AllocaInst(LLVMTypes::MaskType, "continue_lanes_memory");
00385         StoreInst(LLVMMaskAllOff, continueLanesPtr);
00386         breakLanesPtr = AllocaInst(LLVMTypes::MaskType, "break_lanes_memory");
00387         StoreInst(LLVMMaskAllOff, breakLanesPtr);
00388     }
00389 
00390     breakTarget = bt;
00391     continueTarget = ct;
00392     loopMask = NULL; // this better be set by the loop!
00393 }
00394 
00395 
00396 void
00397 FunctionEmitContext::EndLoop() {
00398     assert(controlFlowInfo.size() && !controlFlowInfo.back()->IsIf());
00399     CFInfo *ci = controlFlowInfo.back();
00400     controlFlowInfo.pop_back();
00401 
00402     // Restore the break/continue state information to what it was before
00403     // we went into this loop.
00404     breakTarget = ci->savedBreakTarget;
00405     continueTarget = ci->savedContinueTarget;
00406     breakLanesPtr = ci->savedBreakLanesPtr;
00407     continueLanesPtr = ci->savedContinueLanesPtr;
00408     loopMask = ci->savedLoopMask;
00409 
00410     if (!ci->IsUniform())
00411         // If the loop had a 'uniform' test, then it didn't make any
00412         // changes to the mask so there's nothing to restore.  If it had a
00413         // varying test, we need to restore the mask to what it was going
00414         // into the loop, but still leaving off any lanes that executed a
00415         // 'return' statement.
00416         restoreMaskGivenReturns(ci->savedMask);
00417 }
00418 
00419 
00420 void
00421 FunctionEmitContext::restoreMaskGivenReturns(llvm::Value *oldMask) {
00422     if (!bblock)
00423         return;
00424 
00425     // Restore the mask to the given old mask, but leave off any lanes that
00426     // executed a return statement.
00427     // newMask = (oldMask & ~returnedLanes)
00428     llvm::Value *returnedLanes = LoadInst(returnedLanesPtr, NULL, "returned_lanes");
00429     llvm::Value *notReturned = NotOperator(returnedLanes, "~returned_lanes");
00430     llvm::Value *newMask = BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And,
00431                                           oldMask, notReturned, "new_mask");
00432     SetMask(newMask);
00433 }
00434 
00435 
00436 void
00437 FunctionEmitContext::Break(bool doCoherenceCheck) {
00438     if (breakTarget == NULL) {
00439         Error(currentPos, "\"break\" statement is illegal outside of for/while/do loops.");
00440         return;
00441     }
00442 
00443     // If all of the enclosing 'if' tests in the loop have uniform control
00444     // flow or if we can tell that the mask is all on, then we can just
00445     // jump to the break location.
00446     if (ifsInLoopAllUniform() || GetMask() == LLVMMaskAllOn) {
00447         BranchInst(breakTarget);
00448         if (ifsInLoopAllUniform() && doCoherenceCheck)
00449             Warning(currentPos, "Coherent break statement not necessary in fully uniform "
00450                     "control flow.");
00451         // Set bblock to NULL since the jump has terminated the basic block
00452         bblock = NULL;
00453     }
00454     else {
00455         // Otherwise we need to update the mask of the lanes that have
00456         // executed a 'break' statement:
00457         // breakLanes = breakLanes | mask
00458         assert(breakLanesPtr != NULL);
00459         llvm::Value *mask = GetMask();
00460         llvm::Value *breakMask = LoadInst(breakLanesPtr, NULL, "break_mask");
00461         llvm::Value *newMask = BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Or,
00462                                               mask, breakMask, "mask|break_mask");
00463         StoreInst(newMask, breakLanesPtr);
00464 
00465         // Set the current mask to be all off, just in case there are any
00466         // statements in the same scope after the 'break'.  Most of time
00467         // this will be optimized away since we'll likely end the scope of
00468         // an 'if' statement and restore the mask then.
00469         SetMask(LLVMMaskAllOff);
00470 
00471         if (doCoherenceCheck)
00472             // If the user has indicated that this is a 'coherent' break
00473             // statement, then check to see if the mask is all off.  If so,
00474             // we have to conservatively jump to the continueTarget, not
00475             // the breakTarget, since part of the reason the mask is all
00476             // off may be due to 'continue' statements that executed in the
00477             // current loop iteration.  
00478             // FIXME: if the loop only has break statements and no
00479             // continues, we can jump to breakTarget in that case.
00480             jumpIfAllLoopLanesAreDone(continueTarget);
00481     }
00482 }
00483 
00484 
00485 void
00486 FunctionEmitContext::Continue(bool doCoherenceCheck) {
00487     if (!continueTarget) {
00488         Error(currentPos, "\"continue\" statement illegal outside of for/while/do loops.");
00489         return;
00490     }
00491 
00492     if (ifsInLoopAllUniform() || GetMask() == LLVMMaskAllOn) {
00493         // Similarly to 'break' statements, we can immediately jump to the
00494         // continue target if we're only in 'uniform' control flow within
00495         // loop or if we can tell that the mask is all on.
00496         AddInstrumentationPoint("continue: uniform CF, jumped");
00497         if (ifsInLoopAllUniform() && doCoherenceCheck)
00498             Warning(currentPos, "Coherent continue statement not necessary in fully uniform "
00499                     "control flow.");
00500         BranchInst(continueTarget);
00501         bblock = NULL;
00502     }
00503     else {
00504         // Otherwise update the stored value of which lanes have 'continue'd.
00505         // continueLanes = continueLanes | mask
00506         assert(continueLanesPtr);
00507         llvm::Value *mask = GetMask();
00508         llvm::Value *continueMask = 
00509             LoadInst(continueLanesPtr, NULL, "continue_mask");
00510         llvm::Value *newMask = BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Or,
00511                                               mask, continueMask, "mask|continueMask");
00512         StoreInst(newMask, continueLanesPtr);
00513 
00514         // And set the current mask to be all off in case there are any
00515         // statements in the same scope after the 'continue'
00516         SetMask(LLVMMaskAllOff);
00517 
00518         if (doCoherenceCheck) 
00519             // If this is a 'coherent continue' statement, then emit the
00520             // code to see if all of the lanes are now off due to
00521             // breaks/continues and jump to the continue target if so.
00522             jumpIfAllLoopLanesAreDone(continueTarget);
00523     }
00524 }
00525 
00526 
00527 /** This function checks to see if all of the 'if' statements (if any)
00528     between the current scope and the first enclosing loop have 'uniform'
00529     tests.
00530  */
00531 bool
00532 FunctionEmitContext::ifsInLoopAllUniform() const {
00533     assert(controlFlowInfo.size() > 0);
00534     // Go backwards through controlFlowInfo, since we add new nested scopes
00535     // to the back.  Stop once we come to the first enclosing loop.
00536     int i = controlFlowInfo.size() - 1;
00537     while (i >= 0 && controlFlowInfo[i]->type != CFInfo::Loop) {
00538         if (controlFlowInfo[i]->isUniform == false)
00539             // Found a scope due to an 'if' statement with a varying test
00540             return false;
00541         --i;
00542     }
00543     assert(i >= 0); // else we didn't find a loop!
00544     return true;
00545 }
00546 
00547 
00548 void
00549 FunctionEmitContext::jumpIfAllLoopLanesAreDone(llvm::BasicBlock *target) {
00550     // Check to see if (returned lanes | continued lanes | break lanes) is
00551     // equal to the value of mask at the start of the loop iteration.  If
00552     // so, everyone is done and we can jump to the given target
00553     llvm::Value *returned = LoadInst(returnedLanesPtr, NULL, "returned_lanes");
00554     llvm::Value *continued = LoadInst(continueLanesPtr, NULL, "continue_lanes");
00555     llvm::Value *breaked = LoadInst(breakLanesPtr, NULL, "break_lanes");
00556     llvm::Value *returnedOrContinued = BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Or, 
00557                                                       returned, continued,
00558                                                       "returned|continued");
00559     llvm::Value *returnedOrContinuedOrBreaked = 
00560         BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Or, returnedOrContinued,
00561                        breaked, "returned|continued");
00562 
00563     // Do we match the mask at loop entry?
00564     llvm::Value *allRCB = MasksAllEqual(returnedOrContinuedOrBreaked, loopMask);
00565     llvm::BasicBlock *bAll = CreateBasicBlock("all_continued_or_breaked");
00566     llvm::BasicBlock *bNotAll = CreateBasicBlock("not_all_continued_or_breaked");
00567     BranchInst(bAll, bNotAll, allRCB);
00568 
00569     // If so, have an extra basic block along the way to add
00570     // instrumentation, if the user asked for it.
00571     bblock = bAll;
00572     AddInstrumentationPoint("break/continue: all dynamically went");
00573     BranchInst(target);
00574 
00575     // And set the current basic block to a new one for future instructions
00576     // for the path where we weren't able to jump
00577     bblock = bNotAll;
00578     AddInstrumentationPoint("break/continue: not all went");
00579 }
00580 
00581 
00582 void
00583 FunctionEmitContext::RestoreContinuedLanes() {
00584     if (continueLanesPtr == NULL)
00585         return;
00586 
00587     // mask = mask & continueFlags
00588     llvm::Value *mask = GetMask();
00589     llvm::Value *continueMask = LoadInst(continueLanesPtr, NULL, "continue_mask");
00590     llvm::Value *orMask = BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Or,
00591                                          mask, continueMask, "mask|continue_mask");
00592     SetMask(orMask);
00593 
00594     // continueLanes = 0
00595     StoreInst(LLVMMaskAllOff, continueLanesPtr);
00596 }
00597 
00598 
00599 int
00600 FunctionEmitContext::VaryingCFDepth() const { 
00601     int sum = 0;
00602     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < controlFlowInfo.size(); ++i)
00603         if (controlFlowInfo[i]->IsVaryingType())
00604             ++sum;
00605     return sum;
00606 }
00607 
00608 
00609 void
00610 FunctionEmitContext::CurrentLanesReturned(Expr *expr, bool doCoherenceCheck) {
00611     if (returnType == AtomicType::Void) {
00612         if (expr != NULL)
00613             Error(expr->pos, "Can't return non-void type \"%s\" from void function.",
00614                   expr->GetType()->GetString().c_str());
00615     }
00616     else {
00617         if (expr == NULL) {
00618             Error(funcStartPos,
00619                   "Must provide return value for return statement for non-void function.");
00620             return;
00621         }
00622         
00623         // Use a masked store to store the value of the expression in the
00624         // return value memory; this preserves the return values from other
00625         // lanes that may have executed return statements previously.
00626         Expr *r = expr->TypeConv(returnType, "return statement");
00627         if (r != NULL) {
00628             llvm::Value *retVal = r->GetValue(this);
00629             StoreInst(retVal, returnValuePtr, GetMask(), returnType);
00630         }
00631     }
00632 
00633     if (VaryingCFDepth() == 0) {
00634         // If there is only uniform control flow between us and the
00635         // function entry, then it's guaranteed that all lanes are running,
00636         // so we can just emit a true return instruction
00637         AddInstrumentationPoint("return: uniform control flow");
00638         ReturnInst();
00639     }
00640     else {
00641         // Otherwise we update the returnedLanes value by ANDing it with
00642         // the current lane mask.
00643         llvm::Value *oldReturnedLanes = LoadInst(returnedLanesPtr, NULL,
00644                                                  "old_returned_lanes");
00645         llvm::Value *newReturnedLanes = BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Or, 
00646                                                        oldReturnedLanes, 
00647                                                        GetMask(), "old_mask|returned_lanes");
00648         
00649         // For 'coherent' return statements, emit code to check if all
00650         // lanes have returned
00651         if (doCoherenceCheck) {
00652             // if newReturnedLanes == entryMask, get out of here!
00653             llvm::Value *cmp = MasksAllEqual(entryMask, newReturnedLanes);
00654             llvm::BasicBlock *bDoReturn = CreateBasicBlock("do_return");
00655             llvm::BasicBlock *bNoReturn = CreateBasicBlock("no_return");
00656             BranchInst(bDoReturn, bNoReturn, cmp);
00657 
00658             bblock = bDoReturn;
00659             AddInstrumentationPoint("return: all lanes have returned");
00660             ReturnInst();
00661 
00662             bblock = bNoReturn;
00663         }
00664         // Otherwise update returnedLanesPtr and turn off all of the lanes
00665         // in the current mask so that any subsequent statements in the
00666         // same scope after the return have no effect
00667         StoreInst(newReturnedLanes, returnedLanesPtr);
00668         AddInstrumentationPoint("return: some but not all lanes have returned");
00669         SetMask(LLVMMaskAllOff);
00670     }
00671 }
00672 
00673 
00674 llvm::Value *
00675 FunctionEmitContext::Any(llvm::Value *mask) {
00676     llvm::Value *mmval = LaneMask(mask);
00677     return CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE, mmval,
00678                    LLVMInt32(0), "any_mm_cmp");
00679 }
00680 
00681 
00682 llvm::Value *
00683 FunctionEmitContext::All(llvm::Value *mask) {
00684     llvm::Value *mmval = LaneMask(mask);
00685     return CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_EQ, mmval,
00686                    LLVMInt32((1<<g->target.vectorWidth)-1), "all_mm_cmp");
00687 }
00688 
00689 
00690 llvm::Value *
00691 FunctionEmitContext::LaneMask(llvm::Value *v) {
00692     // Call the target-dependent movmsk function to turn the vector mask
00693     // into an i32 value
00694     std::vector<Symbol *> *mm = m->symbolTable->LookupFunction("__movmsk");
00695     // There should be one with signed int signature, one unsigned int.
00696     assert(mm && mm->size() == 2); 
00697     llvm::Function *fmm = (*mm)[0]->function;
00698     return CallInst(fmm, v, "val_movmsk");
00699 }
00700 
00701 
00702 llvm::Value *
00703 FunctionEmitContext::MasksAllEqual(llvm::Value *v1, llvm::Value *v2) {
00704 #if 0
00705     // Compare the two masks to get a vector of i1s
00706     llvm::Value *cmp = CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_EQ,
00707                                v1, v2, "v1==v2");
00708     // Turn that into a bool vector type (often i32s)
00709     cmp = I1VecToBoolVec(cmp);
00710     // And see if it's all on
00711     return All(cmp);
00712 #else
00713     llvm::Value *mm1 = LaneMask(v1);
00714     llvm::Value *mm2 = LaneMask(v2);
00715     return CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_EQ, mm1, mm2,
00716                    "v1==v2");
00717 #endif
00718 }
00719 
00720 
00721 llvm::Value *
00722 FunctionEmitContext::GetStringPtr(const std::string &str) {
00723     llvm::Constant *lstr = llvm::ConstantArray::get(*g->ctx, str);
00724     llvm::GlobalValue::LinkageTypes linkage = llvm::GlobalValue::InternalLinkage;
00725     llvm::Value *lstrPtr = new llvm::GlobalVariable(*m->module, lstr->getType(),
00726                                                     true /*isConst*/, 
00727                                                     linkage, lstr, "__str");
00728     return new llvm::BitCastInst(lstrPtr, LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType, 
00729                                  "str_void_ptr", bblock);
00730 }
00731 
00732 
00733 llvm::BasicBlock *
00734 FunctionEmitContext::CreateBasicBlock(const char *name) {
00735     llvm::Function *function = bblock->getParent();
00736     return llvm::BasicBlock::Create(*g->ctx, name, function);
00737 }
00738 
00739 
00740 llvm::Value *
00741 FunctionEmitContext::I1VecToBoolVec(llvm::Value *b) {
00742     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType *at = 
00743         llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(b->getType());
00744     if (at) {
00745         // If we're given an array of vectors of i1s, then do the
00746         // conversion for each of the elements
00747         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *boolArrayType = 
00748             llvm::ArrayType::get(LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType, at->getNumElements());
00749         llvm::Value *ret = llvm::UndefValue::get(boolArrayType);
00750 
00751         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < at->getNumElements(); ++i) {
00752             llvm::Value *elt = ExtractInst(b, i);
00753             llvm::Value *sext = SExtInst(elt, LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType, 
00754                                          "val_to_boolvec32");
00755             ret = InsertInst(ret, sext, i);
00756         }
00757         return ret;
00758     }
00759     else
00760         return SExtInst(b, LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType, "val_to_boolvec32");
00761 }
00762 
00763 
00764 llvm::Value *
00765 FunctionEmitContext::SizeOf(LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *ty) {
00766     // Emit code to compute the size of the given type using a GEP with a
00767     // NULL base pointer, indexing one element of the given type, and
00768     // casting the resulting 'pointer' to an int giving its size.
00769     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *ptrType = llvm::PointerType::get(ty, 0);
00770     llvm::Value *nullPtr = llvm::Constant::getNullValue(ptrType);
00771     llvm::Value *index[1] = { LLVMInt32(1) };
00772 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
00773     llvm::ArrayRef<llvm::Value *> arrayRef(&index[0], &index[1]);
00774     llvm::Value *poffset = llvm::GetElementPtrInst::Create(nullPtr, arrayRef,
00775                                                            "offset_ptr", bblock);
00776 #else
00777     llvm::Value *poffset = llvm::GetElementPtrInst::Create(nullPtr, &index[0], &index[1],
00778                                                            "offset_ptr", bblock);
00779 #endif
00780     AddDebugPos(poffset);
00781     llvm::Value *sizeOf = PtrToIntInst(poffset, LLVMTypes::Int64Type, "offset_int");
00782     return sizeOf;
00783 }
00784 
00785 
00786 static llvm::Value *
00787 lGetStringAsValue(llvm::BasicBlock *bblock, const char *s) {
00788     llvm::Constant *sConstant = llvm::ConstantArray::get(*g->ctx, s);
00789     llvm::Value *sPtr = new llvm::GlobalVariable(*m->module, sConstant->getType(), 
00790                                                  true /* const */,
00791                                                  llvm::GlobalValue::InternalLinkage,
00792                                                  sConstant, s);
00793     llvm::Value *indices[2] = { LLVMInt32(0), LLVMInt32(0) };
00794 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
00795     llvm::ArrayRef<llvm::Value *> arrayRef(&indices[0], &indices[2]);
00796     return llvm::GetElementPtrInst::Create(sPtr, arrayRef, "sptr", bblock);
00797 #else
00798     return llvm::GetElementPtrInst::Create(sPtr, &indices[0], &indices[2],
00799                                            "sptr", bblock);
00800 #endif
00801 }
00802 
00803 
00804 void
00805 FunctionEmitContext::AddInstrumentationPoint(const char *note) {
00806     assert(note != NULL);
00807     if (!g->emitInstrumentation)
00808         return;
00809 
00810     std::vector<llvm::Value *> args;
00811     // arg 1: filename as string
00812     args.push_back(lGetStringAsValue(bblock, currentPos.name));
00813     // arg 2: provided note
00814     args.push_back(lGetStringAsValue(bblock, note));
00815     // arg 3: line number
00816     args.push_back(LLVMInt32(currentPos.first_line));
00817     // arg 4: current mask, movmsk'ed down to an int32
00818     args.push_back(LaneMask(GetMask()));
00819 
00820     llvm::Function *finst = m->module->getFunction("ISPCInstrument");
00821     CallInst(finst, args, "");
00822 }
00823 
00824 
00825 void
00826 FunctionEmitContext::SetDebugPos(SourcePos pos) { 
00827     currentPos = pos; 
00828 }
00829 
00830 
00831 SourcePos
00832 FunctionEmitContext::GetDebugPos() const {
00833     return currentPos;
00834 }
00835 
00836 
00837 void
00838 FunctionEmitContext::AddDebugPos(llvm::Value *value, const SourcePos *pos, 
00839                                  llvm::DIScope *scope) {
00840     llvm::Instruction *inst = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::Instruction>(value);
00841     if (inst != NULL && m->diBuilder) {
00842         SourcePos p = pos ? *pos : currentPos;
00843         if (p.first_line != 0)
00844             // If first_line == 0, then we're in the middle of setting up
00845             // the standard library or the like; don't add debug positions
00846             // for those functions
00847             inst->setDebugLoc(llvm::DebugLoc::get(p.first_line, p.first_column, 
00848                                                   scope ? *scope : GetDIScope()));
00849     }
00850 }
00851 
00852 
00853 void
00854 FunctionEmitContext::StartScope() {
00855     if (m->diBuilder != NULL) {
00856         llvm::DIScope parentScope;
00857         if (debugScopes.size() > 0)
00858             parentScope = debugScopes.back();
00859         else
00860             parentScope = diFunction;
00861 
00862         llvm::DILexicalBlock lexicalBlock = 
00863             m->diBuilder->createLexicalBlock(parentScope, diFile,
00864                                              currentPos.first_line,
00865                                              currentPos.first_column);
00866         debugScopes.push_back(lexicalBlock);
00867     }
00868 }
00869 
00870 
00871 void
00872 FunctionEmitContext::EndScope() {
00873     if (m->diBuilder != NULL) {
00874         assert(debugScopes.size() > 0);
00875         debugScopes.pop_back();
00876     }
00877 }
00878 
00879 
00880 llvm::DIScope 
00881 FunctionEmitContext::GetDIScope() const {
00882     assert(debugScopes.size() > 0);
00883     return debugScopes.back();
00884 }
00885 
00886 
00887 void
00888 FunctionEmitContext::EmitVariableDebugInfo(Symbol *sym) {
00889     if (m->diBuilder == NULL)
00890         return;
00891 
00892     llvm::DIScope scope = GetDIScope();
00893     llvm::DIVariable var = 
00894         m->diBuilder->createLocalVariable(llvm::dwarf::DW_TAG_auto_variable,
00895                                           scope,
00896                                           sym->name,
00897                                           sym->pos.GetDIFile(),
00898                                           sym->pos.first_line,
00899                                           sym->type->GetDIType(scope),
00900                                           true /* preserve through opts */);
00901     llvm::Instruction *declareInst = 
00902         m->diBuilder->insertDeclare(sym->storagePtr, var, bblock);
00903     AddDebugPos(declareInst, &sym->pos, &scope);
00904 }
00905 
00906 
00907 void
00908 FunctionEmitContext::EmitFunctionParameterDebugInfo(Symbol *sym) {
00909     if (m->diBuilder == NULL)
00910         return;
00911 
00912     llvm::DIScope scope = diFunction;
00913     llvm::DIVariable var = 
00914         m->diBuilder->createLocalVariable(llvm::dwarf::DW_TAG_arg_variable,
00915                                           scope,
00916                                           sym->name,
00917                                           sym->pos.GetDIFile(),
00918                                           sym->pos.first_line,
00919                                           sym->type->GetDIType(scope),
00920                                           true /* preserve through opts */);
00921     llvm::Instruction *declareInst = 
00922         m->diBuilder->insertDeclare(sym->storagePtr, var, bblock);
00923     AddDebugPos(declareInst, &sym->pos, &scope);
00924 }
00925 
00926 
00927 /** If the given type is an array of vector types, then it's the
00928     representation of an ispc VectorType with varying elements.  If it is
00929     one of these, return the array size (i.e. the VectorType's size).
00930     Otherwise return zero.
00931  */
00932 static int
00933 lArrayVectorWidth(LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *t) {
00934     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType *arrayType = 
00935         llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(t);
00936     if (arrayType == NULL)
00937         return 0;
00938 
00939     // We shouldn't be seeing arrays of anything but vectors being passed
00940     // to things like FunctionEmitContext::BinaryOperator() as operands
00941     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType *vectorElementType = 
00942         llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType>(arrayType->getElementType());
00943     assert(vectorElementType != NULL &&
00944            (int)vectorElementType->getNumElements() == g->target.vectorWidth);
00945     return (int)arrayType->getNumElements();
00946 }
00947 
00948 
00949 llvm::Value *
00950 FunctionEmitContext::BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::BinaryOps inst, 
00951                                     llvm::Value *v0, llvm::Value *v1, 
00952                                     const char *name) {
00953     if (v0 == NULL || v1 == NULL) {
00954         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
00955         return NULL;
00956     }
00957 
00958     assert(v0->getType() == v1->getType());
00959     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *type = v0->getType();
00960     int arraySize = lArrayVectorWidth(type);
00961     if (arraySize == 0) {
00962         llvm::Instruction *bop = 
00963             llvm::BinaryOperator::Create(inst, v0, v1, name ? name : "", bblock);
00964         AddDebugPos(bop);
00965         return bop;
00966     }
00967     else {
00968         // If this is an ispc VectorType, apply the binary operator to each
00969         // of the elements of the array (which in turn should be either
00970         // scalar types or llvm::VectorTypes.)
00971         llvm::Value *ret = llvm::UndefValue::get(type);
00972         for (int i = 0; i < arraySize; ++i) {
00973             llvm::Value *a = ExtractInst(v0, i);
00974             llvm::Value *b = ExtractInst(v1, i);
00975             llvm::Value *op = BinaryOperator(inst, a, b);
00976             ret = InsertInst(ret, op, i);
00977         }
00978         return ret;
00979     }
00980 }
00981 
00982 
00983 llvm::Value *
00984 FunctionEmitContext::NotOperator(llvm::Value *v, const char *name) {
00985     if (v == NULL) {
00986         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
00987         return NULL;
00988     }
00989 
00990     // Similarly to BinaryOperator, do the operation on all the elements of
00991     // the array if we're given an array type; otherwise just do the
00992     // regular llvm operation.
00993     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *type = v->getType();
00994     int arraySize = lArrayVectorWidth(type);
00995     if (arraySize == 0) {
00996         llvm::Instruction *binst = 
00997             llvm::BinaryOperator::CreateNot(v, name ? name : "not", bblock);
00998         AddDebugPos(binst);
00999         return binst;
01000     }
01001     else {
01002         llvm::Value *ret = llvm::UndefValue::get(type);
01003         for (int i = 0; i < arraySize; ++i) {
01004             llvm::Value *a = ExtractInst(v, i);
01005             llvm::Value *op = 
01006                 llvm::BinaryOperator::CreateNot(a, name ? name : "not", bblock);
01007             AddDebugPos(op);
01008             ret = InsertInst(ret, op, i);
01009         }
01010         return ret;
01011     }
01012 }
01013 
01014 
01015 // Given the llvm Type that represents an ispc VectorType, return an
01016 // equally-shaped type with boolean elements.  (This is the type that will
01017 // be returned from CmpInst with ispc VectorTypes).
01018 static LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *
01019 lGetMatchingBoolVectorType(LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *type) {
01020     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType *arrayType = 
01021         llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(type);
01022     // should only be called for vector typed stuff...
01023     assert(arrayType != NULL);
01024 
01025     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType *vectorElementType =
01026         llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType>(arrayType->getElementType());
01027     assert(vectorElementType != NULL &&
01028            (int)vectorElementType->getNumElements() == g->target.vectorWidth);
01029 
01030     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *base = 
01031         llvm::VectorType::get(LLVMTypes::BoolType, g->target.vectorWidth);
01032     return llvm::ArrayType::get(base, arrayType->getNumElements());
01033 }
01034 
01035 
01036 llvm::Value *
01037 FunctionEmitContext::CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::OtherOps inst, 
01038                              llvm::CmpInst::Predicate pred,
01039                              llvm::Value *v0, llvm::Value *v1, 
01040                              const char *name) {
01041     if (v0 == NULL || v1 == NULL) {
01042         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01043         return NULL;
01044     }
01045 
01046     assert(v0->getType() == v1->getType());
01047     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *type = v0->getType();
01048     int arraySize = lArrayVectorWidth(type);
01049     if (arraySize == 0) {
01050         llvm::Instruction *ci = 
01051             llvm::CmpInst::Create(inst, pred, v0, v1, name ? name : "cmp", 
01052                                   bblock);
01053         AddDebugPos(ci);
01054         return ci;
01055     }
01056     else {
01057         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *boolType = lGetMatchingBoolVectorType(type);
01058         llvm::Value *ret = llvm::UndefValue::get(boolType);
01059         for (int i = 0; i < arraySize; ++i) {
01060             llvm::Value *a = ExtractInst(v0, i);
01061             llvm::Value *b = ExtractInst(v1, i);
01062             llvm::Value *op = CmpInst(inst, pred, a, b, name);
01063             ret = InsertInst(ret, op, i);
01064         }
01065         return ret;
01066     }
01067 }
01068 
01069 
01070 llvm::Value *
01071 FunctionEmitContext::BitCastInst(llvm::Value *value, LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *type, 
01072                                  const char *name) {
01073     if (value == NULL) {
01074         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01075         return NULL;
01076     }
01077 
01078     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *valType = value->getType();
01079     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType *at = 
01080         llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(valType);
01081     if (at && llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::PointerType>(at->getElementType())) {
01082         // If we're bitcasting an array of pointers, we have a varying
01083         // lvalue; apply the corresponding bitcast to each of the
01084         // individual pointers and return the result array.
01085         assert((int)at->getNumElements() == g->target.vectorWidth);
01086 
01087         llvm::Value *ret = 
01088             llvm::UndefValue::get(llvm::ArrayType::get(type, g->target.vectorWidth));
01089         for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i) {
01090             llvm::Value *elt = ExtractInst(value, i);
01091             llvm::Value *bc = BitCastInst(elt, type, name);
01092             ret = InsertInst(ret, bc, i);
01093         }
01094         return ret;
01095     }
01096     else {
01097         llvm::Instruction *inst = 
01098             new llvm::BitCastInst(value, type, name ? name : "bitcast", bblock);
01099         AddDebugPos(inst);
01100         return inst;
01101     }
01102 }
01103 
01104 
01105 llvm::Value *
01106 FunctionEmitContext::PtrToIntInst(llvm::Value *value, LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *type,
01107                                   const char *name) {
01108     if (value == NULL) {
01109         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01110         return NULL;
01111     }
01112 
01113     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *valType = value->getType();
01114     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType *at = 
01115         llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(valType);
01116     if (at && llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::PointerType>(at->getElementType())) {
01117         // varying lvalue -> apply ptr to int to the individual pointers
01118         assert((int)at->getNumElements() == g->target.vectorWidth);
01119 
01120         llvm::Value *ret = 
01121             llvm::UndefValue::get(llvm::ArrayType::get(type, g->target.vectorWidth));
01122         for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i) {
01123             llvm::Value *elt = ExtractInst(value, i);
01124             llvm::Value *p2i = PtrToIntInst(elt, type, name);
01125             ret = InsertInst(ret, p2i, i);
01126         }
01127         return ret;
01128     }
01129     else {
01130         llvm::Instruction *inst = 
01131             new llvm::PtrToIntInst(value, type, name ? name : "ptr2int", bblock);
01132         AddDebugPos(inst);
01133         return inst;
01134     }
01135 }
01136 
01137 
01138 llvm::Value *
01139 FunctionEmitContext::IntToPtrInst(llvm::Value *value, LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *type,
01140                                   const char *name) {
01141     if (value == NULL) {
01142         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01143         return NULL;
01144     }
01145 
01146     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *valType = value->getType();
01147     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType *at = 
01148         llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(valType);
01149     if (at && llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::PointerType>(at->getElementType())) {
01150         // varying lvalue -> apply int to ptr to the individual pointers
01151         assert((int)at->getNumElements() == g->target.vectorWidth);
01152 
01153         llvm::Value *ret = 
01154             llvm::UndefValue::get(llvm::ArrayType::get(type, g->target.vectorWidth));
01155         for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i) {
01156             llvm::Value *elt = ExtractInst(value, i);
01157             llvm::Value *i2p = IntToPtrInst(elt, type, name);
01158             ret = InsertInst(ret, i2p, i);
01159         }
01160         return ret;
01161     }
01162     else {
01163         llvm::Instruction *inst = 
01164             new llvm::IntToPtrInst(value, type, name ? name : "int2ptr", bblock);
01165         AddDebugPos(inst);
01166         return inst;
01167     }
01168 }
01169 
01170 
01171 llvm::Instruction *
01172 FunctionEmitContext::TruncInst(llvm::Value *value, LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *type,
01173                                const char *name) {
01174     if (value == NULL) {
01175         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01176         return NULL;
01177     }
01178 
01179     // TODO: we should probably handle the array case as in
01180     // e.g. BitCastInst(), but we don't currently need that functionality
01181     llvm::Instruction *inst = 
01182         new llvm::TruncInst(value, type, name ? name : "trunc", bblock);
01183     AddDebugPos(inst);
01184     return inst;
01185 }
01186 
01187 
01188 llvm::Instruction *
01189 FunctionEmitContext::CastInst(llvm::Instruction::CastOps op, llvm::Value *value,
01190                               LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *type, const char *name) {
01191     if (value == NULL) {
01192         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01193         return NULL;
01194     }
01195 
01196     // TODO: we should probably handle the array case as in
01197     // e.g. BitCastInst(), but we don't currently need that functionality
01198     llvm::Instruction *inst = 
01199         llvm::CastInst::Create(op, value, type, name ? name : "cast", bblock);
01200     AddDebugPos(inst);
01201     return inst;
01202 }

01207                                 const char *name) {
01208     if (value == NULL) {
01209         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01210         return NULL;
01211     }
01212 
01213     // TODO: we should probably handle the array case as in
01214     // e.g. BitCastInst(), but we don't currently need that functionality
01215     llvm::Instruction *inst = 
01216         llvm::CastInst::CreateFPCast(value, type, name ? name : "fpcast", bblock);
01217     AddDebugPos(inst);
01218     return inst;
01219 }

01241                               const char *name) {

01248     // e.g. BitCastInst(), but we don't currently need that functionality

01254 
01255 
01256 llvm::Value *
01257 FunctionEmitContext::GetElementPtrInst(llvm::Value *basePtr, llvm::Value *index0, 
01258                                        llvm::Value *index1, const char *name) {
01259     if (basePtr == NULL || index0 == NULL || index1 == NULL) {
01260         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01261         return NULL;
01262     }
01263 
01264     // FIXME: do we need need to handle the case of the first index being
01265     // varying?  It's currently needed...
01266     assert(!llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType>(index0->getType()));
01267 
01268     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *basePtrType = basePtr->getType();
01269     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType *baseArrayType = 
01270         llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(basePtrType);
01271     bool baseIsVaryingTypePointer = (baseArrayType != NULL) && 
01272         llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::PointerType>(baseArrayType->getElementType());
01273     bool indexIsVaryingType = 
01274         llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType>(index1->getType());
01275 
01276     if (!indexIsVaryingType && !baseIsVaryingTypePointer) {
01277         // The easy case: both the base pointer and the indices are
01278         // uniform, so just emit the regular LLVM GEP instruction
01279         llvm::Value *indices[2] = { index0, index1 };
01280 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
01281         llvm::ArrayRef<llvm::Value *> arrayRef(&indices[0], &indices[2]);
01282         llvm::Instruction *inst = 
01283             llvm::GetElementPtrInst::Create(basePtr, arrayRef,
01284                                             name ? name : "gep", bblock);
01285 #else
01286         llvm::Instruction *inst = 
01287             llvm::GetElementPtrInst::Create(basePtr, &indices[0], &indices[2], 
01288                                             name ? name : "gep", bblock);
01289 #endif
01290         AddDebugPos(inst);
01291         return inst;
01292     }
01293     else {
01294         // We have a varying pointer and/or indices; emit the appropriate
01295         // GEP for each of the program instances
01296         llvm::Value *lret = NULL;
01297         for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i) {
01298             // Get the index, either using the same one if it's uniform or
01299             // the one for this lane if it's varying
01300             llvm::Value *indexElt;
01301             if (indexIsVaryingType)
01302                 indexElt = ExtractInst(index1, i, "get_array_index");
01303             else
01304                 indexElt = index1;
01305 
01306             // Similarly figure out the appropriate base pointer
01307             llvm::Value *aptr;
01308             if (baseIsVaryingTypePointer)
01309                 aptr = ExtractInst(basePtr, i, "get_array_index");
01310             else
01311                 aptr = basePtr;
01312 
01313             // Do the GEP for this lane
01314             llvm::Value *eltPtr = GetElementPtrInst(aptr, index0, indexElt, name);
01315 
01316             if (lret == NULL) {
01317                 // This is kind of a hack: use the type from the GEP to
01318                 // figure out the return type and the first time through,
01319                 // create an undef value of that type here
01320                 LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::PointerType *elementPtrType = 
01321                     llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::PointerType>(eltPtr->getType());
01322                 LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *elementType = 
01323                     elementPtrType->getElementType();
01324                 lret = llvm::UndefValue::get(LLVMPointerVectorType(elementType));
01325             }
01326 
01327             // And insert the result of the GEP into the return value
01328             lret = InsertInst(lret, eltPtr, i, "elt_ptr_store");
01329         }
01330         return lret;
01331     }
01332 }
01333 
01334 
01335 llvm::Value *
01336 FunctionEmitContext::GetElementPtrInst(llvm::Value *basePtr, int v0, int v1,
01337                                        const char *name) {
01338     return GetElementPtrInst(basePtr, LLVMInt32(v0), LLVMInt32(v1), name);
01339 }
01340     
01341 
01342 llvm::Value *
01343 FunctionEmitContext::LoadInst(llvm::Value *lvalue, const Type *type, 
01344                               const char *name) {
01345     if (lvalue == NULL) {
01346         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01347         return NULL;
01348     }
01349 
01350     if (llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::PointerType>(lvalue->getType())) {
01351         // If the lvalue is a straight up regular pointer, then just issue
01352         // a regular load.  First figure out the alignment; in general we
01353         // can just assume the natural alignment (0 here), but for varying
01354         // atomic types, we need to make sure that the compiler emits
01355         // unaligned vector loads, so we specify a reduced alignment here.
01356         int align = 0;
01357         const AtomicType *atomicType = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(type);
01358         if (atomicType != NULL && atomicType->IsVaryingType())
01359             // We actually just want to align to the vector element
01360             // alignment, but can't easily get that here, so just tell LLVM
01361             // it's totally unaligned.  (This shouldn't make any difference
01362             // vs the proper alignment in practice.)
01363             align = 1;
01364         llvm::Instruction *inst = new llvm::LoadInst(lvalue, name ? name : "load",
01365                                                      false /* not volatile */,
01366                                                      align, bblock);
01367         AddDebugPos(inst);
01368         return inst;
01369     }
01370     else {
01371         // Otherwise we should have a varying lvalue and it's time for a
01372         // gather.  The "type" parameter only has to be non-NULL for the
01373         // gather path here (we can't reliably figure out all of the type
01374         // information we need from the LLVM::Type, so have to carry the
01375         // ispc type in through this path..
01376         assert(type != NULL);
01377         assert(llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(lvalue->getType()));
01378         return gather(lvalue, type, name);
01379     }
01380 }
01381 
01382 
01383 llvm::Value *
01384 FunctionEmitContext::gather(llvm::Value *lvalue, const Type *type, 
01385                             const char *name) {
01386     // We should have a varying lvalue if we get here...
01387     assert(llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(lvalue->getType()));
01388 
01389     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *retType = type->LLVMType(g->ctx);
01390 
01391     const StructType *st = dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(type);
01392     if (st) {
01393         // If we're gathering structures, do an element-wise gather
01394         // recursively.
01395         llvm::Value *retValue = llvm::UndefValue::get(retType);
01396         for (int i = 0; i < st->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
01397             llvm::Value *eltPtrs = GetElementPtrInst(lvalue, 0, i);
01398             // This in turn will be another gather
01399             llvm::Value *eltValues = LoadInst(eltPtrs, st->GetElementType(i), 
01400                                               name);
01401             retValue = InsertInst(retValue, eltValues, i, "set_value");
01402         }
01403         return retValue;
01404     }
01405 
01406     const VectorType *vt = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(type);
01407     if (vt) {
01408         // Similarly, if it's a vector type, do a gather for each of the
01409         // vector elements
01410         llvm::Value *retValue = llvm::UndefValue::get(retType);
01411         // FIXME: yuck.  Change lvalues to be pointers to arrays so that
01412         // the GEP stuff in the loop below ends up computing pointers based
01413         // on elements in the vectors rather than incorrectly advancing to
01414         // the next vector...
01415         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *eltType = 
01416             vt->GetBaseType()->GetAsUniformType()->LLVMType(g->ctx);
01417         lvalue = BitCastInst(lvalue, llvm::PointerType::get(llvm::ArrayType::get(eltType, 0), 0));
01418 
01419         for (int i = 0; i < vt->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
01420             llvm::Value *eltPtrs = GetElementPtrInst(lvalue, 0, i);
01421             llvm::Value *eltValues = LoadInst(eltPtrs, vt->GetBaseType(), name);
01422             retValue = InsertInst(retValue, eltValues, i, "set_value");
01423         }
01424         return retValue;
01425     }
01426 
01427     const ArrayType *at = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(type);
01428     if (at) {
01429         // Arrays are also handled recursively and element-wise
01430         llvm::Value *retValue = llvm::UndefValue::get(retType);
01431         for (int i = 0; i < at->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
01432             llvm::Value *eltPtrs = GetElementPtrInst(lvalue, 0, i);
01433             llvm::Value *eltValues = LoadInst(eltPtrs, at->GetElementType(), name);
01434             retValue = InsertInst(retValue, eltValues, i, "set_value");
01435         }
01436         return retValue;
01437     }
01438 
01439     // Otherwise we should just have a basic scalar type and we can go and
01440     // do the actual gather
01441     AddInstrumentationPoint("gather");
01442 
01443     llvm::Value *mask = GetMask();
01444     llvm::Function *gather = NULL;
01445     // Figure out which gather function to call based on the size of
01446     // the elements.
01447     if (retType == LLVMTypes::DoubleVectorType || 
01448         retType == LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType)
01449         gather = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_gather_64");
01450     else if (retType == LLVMTypes::FloatVectorType || 
01451              retType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
01452         gather = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_gather_32");
01453     else if (retType == LLVMTypes::Int16VectorType)
01454         gather = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_gather_16");
01455     else {
01456         assert(retType == LLVMTypes::Int8VectorType);
01457         gather = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_gather_8");
01458     }
01459     assert(gather != NULL);
01460 
01461     llvm::Value *voidlvalue = BitCastInst(lvalue, LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType);
01462     llvm::Instruction *call = CallInst(gather, voidlvalue, mask, name);
01463     // Add metadata about the source file location so that the
01464     // optimization passes can print useful performance warnings if we
01465     // can't optimize out this gather
01466     addGSMetadata(call, currentPos);
01467 
01468     llvm::Value *val = BitCastInst(call, retType, "gather_bitcast");
01469 
01470     return val;
01471 }
01472 
01473 
01474 /** Add metadata to the given instruction to encode the current source file
01475     position.  This data is used in the lGetSourcePosFromMetadata()
01476     function in opt.cpp. 
01477 */
01478 void
01479 FunctionEmitContext::addGSMetadata(llvm::Instruction *inst, SourcePos pos) {
01480     llvm::Value *str = llvm::MDString::get(*g->ctx, pos.name);
01481     llvm::MDNode *md = llvm::MDNode::get(*g->ctx, str);
01482     inst->setMetadata("filename", md);
01483 
01484     llvm::Value *line = LLVMInt32(pos.first_line);
01485     md = llvm::MDNode::get(*g->ctx, line);
01486     inst->setMetadata("line", md);
01487 
01488     llvm::Value *column = LLVMInt32(pos.first_column);
01489     md = llvm::MDNode::get(*g->ctx, column);
01490     inst->setMetadata("column", md);
01491 }
01492 
01493 
01494 llvm::Value *
01495 FunctionEmitContext::AllocaInst(LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *llvmType, const char *name,
01496                                 int align, bool atEntryBlock) {
01497     llvm::AllocaInst *inst = NULL;
01498     if (atEntryBlock) {
01499         // We usually insert it right before the jump instruction at the
01500         // end of allocaBlock
01501         llvm::Instruction *retInst = allocaBlock->getTerminator();
01502         assert(retInst);
01503         inst = new llvm::AllocaInst(llvmType, name ? name : "", retInst);
01504     }
01505     else
01506         // Unless the caller overrode the default and wants it in the
01507         // current basic block
01508         inst = new llvm::AllocaInst(llvmType, name ? name : "", bblock);
01509 
01510     // If no alignment was specified but we have an array of a uniform
01511     // type, then align it to 4 * the native vector width; it's not
01512     // unlikely that this array will be loaded into varying variables with
01513     // what will be aligned accesses if the uniform -> varying load is done
01514     // in regular chunks.
01515     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType *arrayType = 
01516         llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(llvmType);
01517     if (align == 0 && arrayType != NULL && 
01518         !llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType>(arrayType->getElementType()))
01519         align = 4 * g->target.nativeVectorWidth;
01520 
01521     if (align != 0)
01522         inst->setAlignment(align);
01523     // Don't add debugging info to alloca instructions
01524     return inst;
01525 }
01526 
01527 
01528 /** Code to store the given varying value to the given location, only
01529     storing the elements that correspond to active program instances as
01530     given by the provided storeMask value.  Note that the lvalue is only a
01531     single pointer, not a varying lvalue of one pointer per program
01532     instance (that case is handled by scatters).
01533  */
01534 void
01535 FunctionEmitContext::maskedStore(llvm::Value *rvalue, llvm::Value *lvalue,
01536                                  const Type *rvalueType, 
01537                                  llvm::Value *storeMask) {
01538     if (rvalue == NULL || lvalue == NULL) {
01539         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01540         return;
01541     }
01542 
01543     assert(llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::PointerType>(lvalue->getType()));
01544     
01545     const CollectionType *collectionType = 
01546         dynamic_cast<const CollectionType *>(rvalueType);
01547     if (collectionType != NULL) {
01548         // Assigning a structure / array / vector. Handle each element
01549         // individually with what turns into a recursive call to
01550         // makedStore()
01551         for (int i = 0; i < collectionType->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
01552             llvm::Value *eltValue = ExtractInst(rvalue, i, "rvalue_member");
01553             llvm::Value *eltLValue = GetElementPtrInst(lvalue, 0, i, 
01554                                                        "struct_lvalue_ptr");
01555             StoreInst(eltValue, eltLValue, storeMask, 
01556                       collectionType->GetElementType(i));
01557         }
01558         return;
01559     }
01560 
01561     // We must have a regular atomic or enumerator type at this point
01562     assert(dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(rvalueType) != NULL ||
01563            dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(rvalueType) != NULL);
01564     rvalueType = rvalueType->GetAsNonConstType();
01565 
01566     llvm::Function *maskedStoreFunc = NULL;
01567     // Figure out if we need a 8, 16, 32 or 64-bit masked store.
01568     if (rvalueType == AtomicType::VaryingDouble || 
01569         rvalueType == AtomicType::VaryingInt64 ||
01570         rvalueType == AtomicType::VaryingUInt64) {
01571         maskedStoreFunc = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_masked_store_64");
01572         lvalue = BitCastInst(lvalue, LLVMTypes::Int64VectorPointerType, 
01573                              "lvalue_to_int64vecptr");
01574         rvalue = BitCastInst(rvalue, LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType, 
01575                              "rvalue_to_int64");
01576     }
01577     else if (rvalueType == AtomicType::VaryingFloat ||
01578              rvalueType == AtomicType::VaryingBool ||
01579              rvalueType == AtomicType::VaryingInt32 ||
01580              rvalueType == AtomicType::VaryingUInt32 ||
01581              dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(rvalueType) != NULL) {
01582         maskedStoreFunc = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_masked_store_32");
01583         lvalue = BitCastInst(lvalue, LLVMTypes::Int32VectorPointerType, 
01584                              "lvalue_to_int32vecptr");
01585         if (rvalueType == AtomicType::VaryingFloat)
01586             rvalue = BitCastInst(rvalue, LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType, 
01587                                  "rvalue_to_int32");
01588     }
01589     else if (rvalueType == AtomicType::VaryingInt16 ||
01590              rvalueType == AtomicType::VaryingUInt16) {
01591         maskedStoreFunc = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_masked_store_16");
01592         lvalue = BitCastInst(lvalue, LLVMTypes::Int16VectorPointerType, 
01593                              "lvalue_to_int16vecptr");
01594     }
01595     else if (rvalueType == AtomicType::VaryingInt8 ||
01596              rvalueType == AtomicType::VaryingUInt8) {
01597         maskedStoreFunc = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_masked_store_8");
01598         lvalue = BitCastInst(lvalue, LLVMTypes::Int8VectorPointerType, 
01599                              "lvalue_to_int8vecptr");
01600     }
01601 
01602     std::vector<llvm::Value *> args;
01603     args.push_back(lvalue);
01604     args.push_back(rvalue);
01605     args.push_back(storeMask);
01606     CallInst(maskedStoreFunc, args);
01607 }
01608 
01609 
01610 
01611 /** Scatter the given varying value to the locations given by the varying
01612     lvalue (which should be an array of pointers with size equal to the
01613     target's vector width.  We want to store each rvalue element at the
01614     corresponding pointer's location, *if* the mask for the corresponding
01615     program instance are on.  If they're off, don't do anything.  
01616 */
01617 void
01618 FunctionEmitContext::scatter(llvm::Value *rvalue, llvm::Value *lvalue, 
01619                              llvm::Value *storeMask, const Type *rvalueType) {
01620     assert(rvalueType->IsVaryingType());
01621     assert(llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(lvalue->getType()));
01622 
01623     const StructType *structType = dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(rvalueType);
01624     if (structType) {
01625         // Scatter the struct elements individually
01626         for (int i = 0; i < structType->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
01627             llvm::Value *lv = GetElementPtrInst(lvalue, 0, i);
01628             llvm::Value *rv = ExtractInst(rvalue, i);
01629             scatter(rv, lv, storeMask, structType->GetElementType(i));
01630         }
01631         return;
01632     }
01633 
01634     const VectorType *vt = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(rvalueType);
01635     if (vt) {
01636         // FIXME: yuck.  Change lvalues to be pointers to arrays so that
01637         // the GEP stuff in the loop below ends up computing pointers based
01638         // on elements in the vectors rather than incorrectly advancing to
01639         // the next vector...
01640         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *eltType = 
01641             vt->GetBaseType()->GetAsUniformType()->LLVMType(g->ctx);
01642         lvalue = BitCastInst(lvalue, llvm::PointerType::get(llvm::ArrayType::get(eltType, 0), 0));
01643 
01644         for (int i = 0; i < vt->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
01645             llvm::Value *lv = GetElementPtrInst(lvalue, 0, i);
01646             llvm::Value *rv = ExtractInst(rvalue, i);
01647             scatter(rv, lv, storeMask, vt->GetElementType());
01648         }
01649         return;
01650     }
01651 
01652     // I think this should be impossible
01653     assert(dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(rvalueType) == NULL);
01654 
01655     // And everything should be atomic from here on out...
01656     assert(dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(rvalueType) != NULL);
01657 
01658     llvm::Function *func = NULL;
01659     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *type = rvalue->getType();
01660     if (type == LLVMTypes::DoubleVectorType || 
01661         type == LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType) {
01662         func = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_scatter_64");
01663         rvalue = BitCastInst(rvalue, LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType, "rvalue2int");
01664     }
01665     else if (type == LLVMTypes::FloatVectorType || 
01666              type == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType) {
01667         func = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_scatter_32");
01668         rvalue = BitCastInst(rvalue, LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType, "rvalue2int");
01669     }
01670     else if (type == LLVMTypes::Int16VectorType)
01671         func = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_scatter_16");
01672     else if (type == LLVMTypes::Int8VectorType)
01673         func = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_scatter_8");
01674     assert(func != NULL);
01675     
01676     AddInstrumentationPoint("scatter");
01677 
01678     llvm::Value *voidlvalue = BitCastInst(lvalue, LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType);
01679     std::vector<llvm::Value *> args;
01680     args.push_back(voidlvalue);
01681     args.push_back(rvalue);
01682     args.push_back(storeMask);
01683     llvm::Instruction *inst = CallInst(func, args);
01684     addGSMetadata(inst, currentPos);
01685 }
01686 
01687 
01688 void
01689 FunctionEmitContext::StoreInst(llvm::Value *rvalue, llvm::Value *lvalue,
01690                                const char *name) {
01691     if (rvalue == NULL || lvalue == NULL) {
01692         // may happen due to error elsewhere
01693         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01694         return;
01695     }
01696 
01697     llvm::Instruction *inst;
01698     if (llvm::isa<llvm::VectorType>(rvalue->getType()))
01699         // Specify an unaligned store, since we don't know that the lvalue
01700         // will in fact be aligned to a vector width here.  (Actually
01701         // should be aligned to the alignment of the vector elment type...)
01702         inst = new llvm::StoreInst(rvalue, lvalue, false /* not volatile */,
01703                                    1, bblock);
01704     else
01705         inst = new llvm::StoreInst(rvalue, lvalue, bblock);
01706 
01707     AddDebugPos(inst);
01708 }
01709 
01710 
01711 void
01712 FunctionEmitContext::StoreInst(llvm::Value *rvalue, llvm::Value *lvalue,
01713                                llvm::Value *storeMask, const Type *rvalueType,
01714                                const char *name) {
01715     if (rvalue == NULL || lvalue == NULL) {
01716         // may happen due to error elsewhere
01717         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01718         return;
01719     }
01720 
01721     // Figure out what kind of store we're doing here
01722     if (rvalueType->IsUniformType()) {
01723         // The easy case; a regular store, natural alignment is fine
01724         llvm::Instruction *si = new llvm::StoreInst(rvalue, lvalue, bblock);
01725         AddDebugPos(si);
01726     }
01727     else if (llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(lvalue->getType()))
01728         // We have a varying lvalue (an array of pointers), so it's time to
01729         // scatter
01730         scatter(rvalue, lvalue, storeMask, rvalueType);
01731     else if (storeMask == LLVMMaskAllOn) {
01732         // Otherwise it is a masked store unless we can determine that the
01733         // mask is all on...
01734         StoreInst(rvalue, lvalue, name);
01735     }
01736     else
01737         maskedStore(rvalue, lvalue, rvalueType, storeMask);
01738 }
01739

01741 void
01742 FunctionEmitContext::BranchInst(llvm::BasicBlock *dest) {
01743     llvm::Instruction *b = llvm::BranchInst::Create(dest, bblock);
01744     AddDebugPos(b);
01745 }

01750                                 llvm::BasicBlock *falseBlock,
01751                                 llvm::Value *test) {
01752     if (test == NULL) {
01753         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01754         return;
01755     }
01756 
01757     llvm::Instruction *b = 
01758         llvm::BranchInst::Create(trueBlock, falseBlock, test, bblock);
01759     AddDebugPos(b);
01760 }

01763 llvm::Value *
01764 FunctionEmitContext::ExtractInst(llvm::Value *v, int elt, const char *name) {
01765     if (v == NULL) {
01766         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01767         return NULL;
01768     }
01769 
01770     llvm::Instruction *ei = NULL;
01771     if (llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType>(v->getType()))
01772         ei = llvm::ExtractElementInst::Create(v, LLVMInt32(elt), 
01773                                               name ? name : "extract", bblock);
01774     else
01775         ei = llvm::ExtractValueInst::Create(v, elt, name ? name : "extract",
01776                                             bblock);
01777     AddDebugPos(ei);
01778     return ei;
01779 }

01783 FunctionEmitContext::InsertInst(llvm::Value *v, llvm::Value *eltVal, int elt, 
01784                                 const char *name) {
01785     if (v == NULL || eltVal == NULL) {
01786         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01787         return NULL;
01788     }
01789 
01790     llvm::Instruction *ii = NULL;
01791     if (llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType>(v->getType()))
01792         ii = llvm::InsertElementInst::Create(v, eltVal, LLVMInt32(elt), 
01793                                              name ? name : "insert", bblock);
01794     else
01795         ii = llvm::InsertValueInst::Create(v, eltVal, elt, 
01796                                            name ? name : "insert", bblock);
01797     AddDebugPos(ii);
01798     return ii;
01799 }

01807                                               count,

01831 llvm::Instruction *
01832 FunctionEmitContext::CallInst(llvm::Function *func, 
01833                               const std::vector<llvm::Value *> &args,
01834                               const char *name) {
01835     if (func == NULL) {
01836         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01837         return NULL;
01838     }
01839 
01840 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
01841     llvm::Instruction *ci = 
01842         llvm::CallInst::Create(func, args, name ? name : "", bblock);
01843 #else
01844     llvm::Instruction *ci = 
01845         llvm::CallInst::Create(func, args.begin(), args.end(), 
01846                                name ? name : "", bblock);
01847 #endif
01848     AddDebugPos(ci);
01849     return ci;
01850 }

01853 llvm::Instruction *
01854 FunctionEmitContext::CallInst(llvm::Function *func, llvm::Value *arg, 
01855                               const char *name) {
01856     if (func == NULL || arg == NULL) {
01857         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01858         return NULL;
01859     }
01860 
01861 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
01862     llvm::Instruction *ci = 
01863         llvm::CallInst::Create(func, arg, name ? name : "", bblock);
01864 #else
01865     llvm::Value *args[] = { arg };
01866     llvm::Instruction *ci = 
01867         llvm::CallInst::Create(func, &args[0], &args[1], name ? name : "",
01868                                bblock);
01869 #endif
01870     AddDebugPos(ci);
01871     return ci;
01872 }
